intro: Peltophyllum, commonly known as the shield fern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped leaves that are often deeply lobed. Peltophyllum species typically grow in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
